title: Session 1
description: Introduction to the SARS-CoV-2 Luminex multi-antigen serology assay
contents:
Description:
In this session you will go over the theory of the multi-antigen Luminex assay and tips on how to set up your assay in the lab.
 Session details:
10th March 2022, 8:30-09:00am GMT+10
 Materials:

 Slides Video

Acknowledgments
This workshop was designed for Papua New Guinea Institute for Medical Research researchers and led by Dr. Shazia Ruybal-Pesántez, Dr. Maria Ome-Kaius and Dr. Fiona Angrisano.
Funding for this workshop was provided by a Regional Collaborations Programme COVID-19 Digital Grant from the Australian Academy of Science and Australian Department of Industry, Science, Energy and Resources.

title: Session 2
description: Introduction to the COVID-19 serological surveys that have been conducted in PNG
contents:
Description:
In this session you will be introduced to the purpose of serosurveillance research and programs and will go over the COVID-19 serological surveys that have been conducted in PNG.
 Session details:
10th March 2022, 09:00-09:30am GMT+10
 Materials:

 Slides Video

Acknowledgments
This workshop was designed for Papua New Guinea Institute for Medical Research researchers and led by Dr. Shazia Ruybal-Pesántez, Dr. Maria Ome-Kaius and Dr. Fiona Angrisano.
Funding for this workshop was provided by a Regional Collaborations Programme COVID-19 Digital Grant from the Australian Academy of Science and Australian Department of Industry, Science, Energy and Resources.

title: Session 3
description: Data preparation and how to go from Luminex machine to Shiny app
contents:
Description:
In this session you will go over how to prepare your data to upload to the covidClassifyR app
 Session details:
10th March 2022, 10:00-10:30am GMT+10
 Materials:
